body_content.explanation: used for describing young adults who may behave as if they have not yet fully developed into adults:
examples: They were a bunch of fame-struck post-adolescent wannabes.
His post-adolescent peer group believed themselves to be intellectuals.

body_content.explanation: relating to the period soon after someone becomes an adult, when they may behave as if they have not yet fully developed into an adult:
examples: He says that he worked through a lot of his post-adolescent angst on the first album.
The research focused on postadolescent transition from high school into higher education and adult life.

body_content.explanation: used for describing people who are adults rather than children:
examples: Cellulite appears in 90% of post-adolescent women.

body_content.explanation: relating to any period after someone becomes an adult:
examples: Post-adolescent acne may be "persistent acne" (continuing from adolescence) or "late-onset acne".
Very few studies compare the health of twins who were raised together, but who differ in their postadolescent socioeconomic position.

body_content.explanation: someone who has recently become an adult, but who may behave as if they have not yet fully developed into an adult:
examples: Some students are moody post-adolescents, still working out what it means to be adults.
The team needs experienced muscle, not post-adolescents.

body_content.explanation: someone who is an adult rather than a child:
examples: He believed that post-adolescents cannot acquire new dialects in the way that pre-adolescents can.
